sentence.Network_en: My expostulation ( s ) had no effect.
sentence.Network_cn: 我提出的劝告毫无作用.

sentence.Network_en: In his expostulation he dropped his cleaner hand ( perhaps accidentally , perhaps not ) upon the joker's heart.
sentence.Network_cn: 说话时他那只干净手 有意无意 地落到了那开玩笑的人心口.

sentence.Network_en: I now went into an earnest expostulation with him upon the extravagant length of his report.
sentence.Network_cn: 接着我就开始苦口婆心地劝导他,说他写的报告过分冗长.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 晨读5分钟|公平对待命运 ... profuse 丰富的 expostulation 劝告 reproach 责备.
双语美文：公平对待命运_新沪江英语网... ... Hence 从此，以后2.因此 expostulation 劝告,谏言 niggardly 吝啬的;小气的;少的.

list.abs: shijing and the expostulation culture of pre - qin and han dynasty ., < 诗经 > 与先秦两汉劝谏文化.
He expostulated with me on my rashness ., 他劝诫我别鲁莽.
My expostulations had no results ., 我的劝诫均无结果.
the study of the expostulation system of qing dynasty ., 清代谏议制度研究.

means.word_mean: 1. the act of expressing earnest opposition or protest
2. an exclamation of protest or remonstrance or reproof
